title: Getting Started With Laravel: Why Laravel and How To Install
excerpt: Thinking about starting a new web project? Discover why Laravel is a top choice for PHP developers and follow our step-by-step guide on how to get it installed and running on your system.
content:
Getting Started With Laravel: Why Laravel and How To Install

Laravel has become one of the most popular PHP frameworks for building web applications. Its elegant syntax, robust features, and large community make it a go-to choice for developers worldwide.

Why Choose Laravel?

Laravel offers numerous benefits:

  • MVC Architecture: A clear structure that separates concerns.
  • Eloquent ORM: Powerful database interaction with simple syntax.
  • Blade Templating Engine: Fast and simple templating.
  • Artisan Console: Command-line interface for common tasks.
  • Security Features: Built-in protection against common web vulnerabilities.
  • Large Community: Extensive documentation and community support.

How to Install Laravel

Before installing Laravel, ensure you have:

  • PHP >= 8.1
  • Composer installed
  • Database server (like MySQL, PostgreSQL, etc.)

Step 1: Install Composer

Composer is a dependency manager for PHP. If you don't have it, download and install it from getcomposer.org.

Step 2: Create a New Laravel Project

Open your terminal or command prompt and run the following command:

composer create-project laravel/laravel your-project-name

Replace your-project-name with the desired name for your project.

Step 3: Navigate to Project Directory

cd your-project-name

Step 4: Serve the Application

You can start the local development server using Artisan:

php artisan serve

Your Laravel application should now be accessible in your web browser at http://127.0.0.1:8000.

Congratulations! You've successfully installed Laravel. You are now ready to start building your web application with this powerful framework.
